DataElement.preferredName: Patient Medical History Non Muscle Invasive Bladder Cancer Stage
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Code to describe the stage of non-muscle invasive bladder cancer if the patient has a history of disease.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Medical History Non Muscle Invasive Bladder Cancer
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._an account of all medical events and problems a person has experienced._An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction._Muscle; one of the contractile organs of the body._Marked by a tendency to spread especially into healthy tissue._A carcinoma arising from the bladder epithelium.  Approximately 90% of the bladder carcinomas are transitional cell carcinomas.  The remainder are squamous cell carcinomas, adenocarcinomas and small cell neuroendocrine carcinomas.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.:an account of all medical events and problems a person has experienced.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.
A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.

Property.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.:Muscle; one of the contractile organs of the body.:Marked by a tendency to spread especially into healthy tissue.:A carcinoma arising from the bladder epithelium.  Approximately 90% of the bladder carcinomas are transitional cell carcinomas.  The remainder are squamous cell carcinomas, adenocarcinomas and small cell neuroendocrine carcinomas.

Concepts.definition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
One of the contractile organs of the body.
Marked by a tendency to spread, especially into healthy surrounding tissue.

A carcinoma arising from the bladder epithelium.  Approximately 90% of the bladder carcinomas are transitional cell carcinomas.  The remainder are squamous cell carcinomas, adenocarcinomas and small cell neuroendocrine carcinomas.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Released per approval by T.Lichtenberg. mc 10/5/11

ValueDomain.preferredName: Non Muscle Invasive Bladder Cancer Stage
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction._Muscle; one of the contractile organs of the body._Marked by a tendency to spread especially into healthy tissue._A carcinoma arising from the bladder epithelium.  Approximately 90% of the bladder carcinomas are transitional cell carcinomas.  The remainder are squamous cell carcinomas, adenocarcinomas and small cell neuroendocrine carcinomas._The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Breast Cancer pTis TNM Finding v6 and v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Breast cancer with a finding of carcinoma in situ. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

Concepts.longName: Breast Cancer pTis TNM Finding v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Breast cancer with a finding of carcinoma in situ. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A clinical and/or pathologic primary tumor TNM finding indicating that the cancer is limited to the site of growth.

Concepts.definition: A clinical and/or pathologic primary tumor TNM finding indicating that the cancer is limited to the site of growth.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A term that refers to a TNM finding of a primary, non-invasive, papillary cancer.

Concepts.definition: A term that refers to a TNM finding of a primary, non-invasive, papillary cancer.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.

Concepts.definition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
One of the contractile organs of the body.
Marked by a tendency to spread, especially into healthy surrounding tissue.

A carcinoma arising from the bladder epithelium.  Approximately 90% of the bladder carcinomas are transitional cell carcinomas.  The remainder are squamous cell carcinomas, adenocarcinomas and small cell neuroendocrine carcinomas.
The extent of a cancer in the body.
